required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study for the Evaluation of the Role of HIV-1 Tat Protein and Anti-Tat Immune Response In HIV Reservoir
clinical_study.official_title: Observational Study for the Evaluation of the Role of HIV-1 Tat Protein and Anti-Tat Immune Response in Peripheral Blood HIV Reservoir Dynamics

brief_summary.textblock: A longitudinal observational study in HIV-infected subjects receiving cART addressed to explore the effect of the Tat protein and anti-Tat immunity on the formation and maintenance of HIV-1 virus reservoir.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study is designed as a longitudinal observational study addressed to identify the effects of Tat protein and humoral/cellular anti-Tat immune responses (induced in the natural infection or by Tat vaccination) in HIV-1 reservoir dynamics in blood of HIV infected patients receiving cART. HIV DNA data will be used for analyzing the decay dynamics.
The primary objective of the study is to determine the rate of decay of total HIV DNA in blood of anti-Tat antibody (Ab) positive versus anti-Tat Ab negative HIV patients receiving cART.
The secondary objectives of the study are to relate the HIV DNA decay data to:
1. the persistence of anti-Tat humoral responses;
2. biomarkers of HIV reservoir stability potentially affected by the Tat protein or anti-Tat immune responses, including: i) apoptotic/survival index of CD4+ T cells; ii) reactivation dynamics of latent HIV in resting CD4+ T cells upon exposure to Tat protein and/or activation stimuli; iii) cellular and humoral biomarkers relevant to inflammation and immune dysregulation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and through study completion, an average of 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Changes of total HIV-1 proviral DNA copies/1.000.000 CD4+ T-cells

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and through study completion, an average of 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Changes of HIV plasma viral load (copies/mL)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and through study completion, an average of 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Changes of CD4+ and CD8+ T-cell counts (cells/microL)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and through study completion, an average of 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Apoptotic index of isolated lymphocytes subsets

secondary_outcome.measure: Induction of replication of competent latent HIV-1 from resting CD4+ T-cell
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and through study completion, an average of 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Quantification of replication competent latent HIV-1 from isolated resting CD4+ T cells [TZM-bl cell based assay (TZA)]

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and through study completion, an average of 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma levels of inflammation and immune activation biomarkers

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and through study completion, an average of 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-Tat humoral response in terms of anti-Tat IgM, IgG and IgA Ab

biospec_descr.textblock: Periferal blood mononuclear cells and plasma

study_pop.textblock: HIV-1 infected adult subjects of either gender, ≥18 years old, under cART, with CD4+ T-cell count ≥250 cells/µL.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age ≥18 years
2. Diagnosis of HIV-1 infection
3. To be under cART treatment
4. CD4+ T-cell count ≥250 cells/microliters
5. Testing for anti-Tat Ab performed during pre-screening
6. Signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Current therapy with immunomodulators or immunosuppressive drugs or chemotherapy for neoplastic disorders.

facility.name: Infectious Dermatology STI Unit San Gallicano Dermatologic Institute , IRCCS
